channel.title: [317] How do you make a ::explock command?{Lock Please?}
channel.description: Can someone help me make a ::explock and ::unlock command?

item.title: [317] How do you make a ::explock command?{Lock Please?}
item.dc:creator: @frostscapeserver frostscapeserver
item.description:
@frostscapeserver wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]‘Tokens’ are what declare the character file to save.

Such as ‘PlayerRights = 0’
‘PlayerRights’ would be the token.

Search server-sided, client.java for ‘token’

Hope this helps, -Tom.[/quote]

Thank you. Can a moderator close this please?

Read full topic
item.source: [317] How do you make a ::explock command?{Lock Please?}

W-w-waaait a minute. How are you gonna run a server without basic knowledge?

And BTW I searched on moparscape for a guide on it and the only one I found said I didn’t have the ‘rights’ to view the post.

item.title: [317] How do you make a ::explock command?{Lock Please?}
item.dc:creator: @homeboy927 homeboy927
item.description:
@homeboy927 wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:6, topic:319674”]xp lock is easy. In client.java declare

public int xplock;

Then make that save to your character file.

Next go to your addskillxp methods and at the top of each of them put:

if (xplock == 0) {

Now just add this command:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("xplock") { if (xplock == 0) { xplock = 1; sendMessage("You lock your xp!"); } else { xplock = 0; sendMessage("You unlock your xp!"); } }[/quote]

Was that what you were looking for?

Read full topic
